pullRequest.body:
Define exponentially tilted measures. The exponential tilting of a measure `Œº` on `Œ±` by a function `f : Œ± ‚Üí ‚Ñù` is the measure with density `x ‚Ü¶ exp (f x) / ‚à´ y, exp (f y) ‚àÇŒº` with respect to `Œº`. 

---

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion title = {On the probability function in the collective theory of risk}, ```

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion year = {1932} ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion [SigmaFinite ŒΩ] (hŒºŒΩ : Œº ‚â™ ŒΩ) {f : Œ± ‚Üí ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû} (hf : AEMeasurable f ŒΩ) : ```
do you really need `hŒΩŒ∫` for this one?
Thanks for spotting this. I removed the assumption.

```suggestion
    {Œº : MeasureTheory.Measure Œ±} (hf : AEMeasurable (fun x ‚Ü¶ exp (f x)) Œº) :
```
don't you want to exchange the primed and non-primed version? I expect most of the time this will be used with probability measures. Same thing below.

```suggestion
lemma toReal_rnDeriv_tilted_right (Œº ŒΩ : Measure Œ±) [SigmaFinite Œº] [SigmaFinite ŒΩ]
```

```suggestion
lemma toReal_rnDeriv_tilted_left {ŒΩ : Measure Œ±} [SigmaFinite Œº] [SigmaFinite ŒΩ]
```
You haven't swapped the prime on this one and the next one.
